instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V35_CAM: What is PP1V35_CAM? PP1V35_CAM is a 1.35v power rail to power the webcam. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP1V05_SUS: What is PP1V05_SUS? The PP1V05_SUS signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that supplies 1.05 volts, typically used in a suspended (SUS) state of the laptop. This state is a low-power mode where essential system functions are maintained, but the majority of the system is powered down..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> Shorted
threads.message:
Clean board in S0 state <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> heats up as <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> is shorted, I replaced the <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> chip but the short comes back after I install a new <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> with <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> removed the short is gone, <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> also gets a little hot.

I am puzzled with this board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> Shorted
threads.message: What is the exact ohm value of the short?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> Shorted
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> Shorted
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> Shorted
threads.message:
Removed <CHIP>U4000</CHIP> short still there, replacing <CHIP>U4000</CHIP> at this point will be useless.

One thing to note is that it is hard to remove <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> without damaging it, the solder is very hard to come to melt and by the time you remove it you may have fried the chip, so to remove it from donor board I applied max hear and air from under the donor board and eventually it comes off without damaging the chip, then reball the chip with 183c paste and install it with 365c and no damage should occur to chip, but in my case I have tried 2 chips and short still there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> Shorted
threads.message:
Ok some of my donor boards were also shorted on that same line and I did not bother to check and end up installing 2 bad chips, finally I checked and found a good one, short gone but now board makes it to S0 state but no boot.

<SIGNAL>PP1V05_SUS</SIGNAL> 1.5v
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> 1.5v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> 
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> 0.35v
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 0.06v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> Shorted
threads.message:
Diode mode at L7630?
Check voltage and enable signals for <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> Shorted
threads.message:
0.166 diode mode on L7630

<CHIP>U7600</CHIP>
pin 12 5.1v
pin 8 1v
pin 16 3.3v
pin 17 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> Shorted
threads.message:
Change <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>.
Check all its traces, solders and surrounding components.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> Shorted
threads.message: Diferent behaivior but not boot, Im done with this board, thanks for help!
